research_content:
Perfect! Now I have comprehensive research. Let me compile a detailed report based on all my findings:

---

## COMPREHENSIVE RESEARCH: Transitional and Emergency Housing for Veterans Beyond Federal Programs

Based on my research of the Vibe4Vets codebase and current web resources, here's a detailed compilation of Veteran housing organizations and programs operating outside the primary federal programs (SSVF, HUD-VASH, GPD):

---

### 1. MAJOR NATIONAL VETERAN HOUSING ORGANIZATIONS

#### **Volunteers of America (VOA)**
- **Website:** https://www.voa.org/veterans
- **Phone:** 1-800-899-0089
- **Type of Housing:** Transitional housing, permanent supportive housing, SSVF programs
- **Geographic Scope:** National (30+ states)
- **Services Offered:**
  - Transitional and permanent supportive housing
  - Employment training and job placement
  - Mental health and substance abuse treatment
  - Case management
  - Legal services
  
- **Regional Locations:**
  - Ohio & Indiana (Brandon Hall, Chambers Park, multiple sites in Cincinnati, Cleveland, Columbus)
  - Spokane, Washington (12 one-bedroom apartments at 6208 N. Lacey St. - opened Jan 2026)
  - New York (serving 700+ veterans annually, largest provider in NYC)
  - Florida (19 communities from Pensacola to Key West)
  - Los Angeles (multiple sites in Boyle Heights, Santa Ana, Compton, West Covina)
  - Tallahassee, Florida (Veterans Village)
  - Southeast Louisiana
  - Chesapeake area (Virginia/Carolinas)

- **Eligibility:** Veterans experiencing homelessness or at risk of homelessness, transitioning from military
- **Tier:** 2 (Established nonprofit)

---

#### **U.S. VETS (US VETS Inc.)**
- **Website:** https://usvets.org/
- **Phone:** (877) 548-7838 (1-877-5-4USVETS)
- **Type of Housing:** Emergency shelter, transitional housing, permanent supportive housing
- **Geographic Scope:** National with major urban centers
- **Services Offered:**
  - Low-barrier emergency shelter (24/7 access)
  - Transitional housing programs
  - Permanent supportive housing
  - Case management
  - Comprehensive wraparound services

- **Locations:**
  - Phoenix, Arizona
  - Houston, Texas
  - Las Vegas, Nevada
  - Washington, D.C.
  - Long Beach, California
  - Inland Empire, California
  - Wai'anae, Hawaii
  - Barber's Point, Hawaii
  - Inglewood, California
  - Prescott, Arizona

- **Eligibility:** Veterans experiencing homelessness or at risk, accepts families
- **Tier:** 2 (Established nonprofit)

---

#### **Veterans Community Project (VCP)**
- **Website:** https://vcp.org/
- **Type of Housing:** Permanent tiny homes for formerly homeless veterans
- **Housing Model:** 240-320 square foot fully furnished tiny homes
- **Success Rate:** 85% transition to permanent housing

- **Current Locations:**
  - Kansas City, Missouri (VCP Village - 49 tiny homes at 89th and Troost, completed 2019)
  - Denver, Colorado
  - Nashville, Tennessee
  - St. Louis, Missouri
  - Expanding to major cities nationwide

- **Support Services:**
  - Case management
  - Village Center with fellowship hall, dental clinic, medical services, veterinary services
  - Wraparound services
  - Employment training
  - All utilities, furniture, and household items provided
  - Veterans keep furniture when transitioning to permanent housing

- **Eligibility:** Formerly homeless veterans
- **Tier:** 2 (Innovative nonprofit model)

---

#### **Swords to Plowshares**
- **Website:** https://www.swords-to-plowshares.org/
- **Location:** San Francisco Bay Area
- **Phone:** Available through website
- **Founded:** 1974 by Vietnam Veterans
- **Type of Housing:** Permanent supportive housing, transitional housing, rental assistance
- **Geographic Scope:** Bay Area/San Francisco County

- **Housing Portfolio:**
  - 500 units of permanent supportive housing in San Francisco
  - On-site services: staff presence, activities, meals
  - Rental assistance for secure own apartments
  - Low-barrier transitional housing
  - 1035 Van Ness Avenue project: 124 permanent homes (under development)

- **Services Offered:**
  - Housing + case management
  - Peer counseling
  - Mental health care
  - In-home habitability support
  - Transportation to medical appointments
  - Healthcare navigation
  - Daily meals
  - Legal aid
  - Employment services

- **Eligibility:** Formerly homeless veterans with disabilities
- **Tier:** 2 (Established nonprofit, 50+ year history)

---

### 2. FAITH-BASED HOUSING ORGANIZATIONS

**Note:** The codebase already includes comprehensive documentation of faith-based organizations in `/backend/data/reference/faith_based_veteran_services.json`. Key housing providers:

#### **The Salvation Army**
- **Website:** https://www.salvationarmyusa.org/usn/veterans/
- **Phone:** 1-800-728-7825
- **Type of Housing:** Emergency shelters, transitional housing, Harbor Light Centers for residential treatment
- **Geographic Scope:** National
- **Services:**
  - Emergency shelter
  - Transitional housing (up to 9 months)
  - Residential treatment (6-12 months)
  - Food assistance
  - Job training
  - Substance abuse treatment
  - Case management

- **Specific Locations Mentioned:**
  - Beaverton, Oregon (14825 SW Farmington Rd - 60 beds)
  - Palm Beach County, Florida (23-bed center)
  - Ann Arbor, Michigan (3660 Packard - 11 beds)
  - Dallas, Texas
  - Multiple locations nationwide

- **Eligibility:** Veterans and families in emergency/transitional need
- **Tier:** 2 (Major established nonprofit)

---

#### **Catholic Charities USA**
- **Website:** https://www.catholiccharitiesusa.org/our-ministry/veterans-services/
- **Type of Housing:** SSVF programs, transitional housing, permanent supportive housing
- **Geographic Scope:** National (35+ dioceses)
- **Services:**
  - Rapid rehousing and homelessness prevention
  - Transitional housing
  - Emergency financial assistance
  - Mental health services
  - Employment services
  - Benefits counseling
  - Legal referrals

- **Specific Programs/Locations:**
  - Michael's Place, Washington (18 beds for recovery)
  - Liberty House, New Hampshire (4-step substance-free program)
  - Sacred Heart Veteran Village, Michigan (24-26 tiny homes - transitional)
  - MANA House, Arizona (peer support)
  - Hawaii housing solutions
  - Multiple locations nationwide

- **Eligibility:** Veterans experiencing homelessness or housing instability
- **Tier:** 2 (Major established nonprofit)

---

#### **Volunteers of America (also faith-based)**
- See detailed listing above under Major National Organizations

---

### 3. REGIONAL/SPECIALIZED VETERAN HOUSING NONPROFITS

#### **Veterans Affordable Housing Program**
- **Website:** https://veteransaffordablehousing.org/
- **Type of Housing:** Permanent affordable housing
- **Geographic Scope:** California (Southern California communities listed)
- **Services:** Housing development and management
- **Tier:** 2-3 (Regional nonprofit)

---

#### **Veterans Village of San Diego (VVSD)**
- **Website:** https://vvsd.net/
- **Location:** San Diego, California
- **Type of Housing:** Permanent supportive housing, transitional housing
- **Services:**
  - Housing programs
  - Case management
  - Support services
- **Housing Units:** Vets Villas in Escondido, CA
- **Tier:** 2 (Regional nonprofit)

---

#### **Nation's Finest Veteran Services** (formerly Vietnam Veterans of California)
- **Locations:** 30 locations in 15 communities across California, Arizona, Nevada
- **Type of Housing:** 300+ units of permanent supportive housing, transitional housing with clinical services
- **Services:**
  - Permanent supportive housing
  - Transitional housing for veterans with mental health challenges
  - Clinical services
  - Employment and training programs
  - Legal aid
  - Personalized case management
- **Scope:** Serves 6,800+ veterans annually
- **Tier:** 2 (Regional nonprofit)

---

#### **Veterans Outreach of Wisconsin**
- **Website:** https://vowvillages.com/veteran-village
- **Location:** Racine, Wisconsin
- **Type of Housing:** James A. Peterson Veteran Village
- **Services:** Housing, SC Johnson Community Center services
- **Tier:** 2-3 (Regional nonprofit)

---

### 4. SPECIAL POPULATIONS HOUSING

#### **Final Salute Inc.** (Women Veterans)
- **Website:** https://www.finalsaluteinc.org/
- **Phone:** 866-472-5883
- **Location:** National Capital Region (DC, Northern VA, Southern MD)
- **Type of Housing:** Transitional housing for women veterans and children
- **Services:**
  - Safe housing for women veterans
  - Pet-friendly options
  - Wraparound services
- **Geographic Scope:** DC metro area
- **Eligibility:** Women veterans experiencing homelessness or at risk
- **Tier:** 2 (Specialized nonprofit)

---

### 5. MILITARY FAMILY HOUSING (During VA Treatment)

#### **Fisher House Foundation**
- **Website:** https://www.fisherhouse.org/
- **Type of Housing:** Free temporary housing for military families while receiving VA treatment
- **Purpose:** Enables families to be close during medical treatment or during end-of-life situations
- **Network Scale:** 100+ locations across U.S., Germany, and UK

- **Specific Locations:**
  - Michigan (Ann Arbor, Detroit)
  - Los Angeles
  - Houston (multiple Fisher Houses - VA first with 3)
  - Camp Pendleton, California
  - And many more nationwide

- **How to Access:**
  - Contact local VA Medical Center
  - Referral-based system
  - Free stays during treatment

- **Eligibility:** Families of active-duty service members, veterans receiving VA medical treatment, end-of-life care situations
- **Tier:** 1 (Federal-affiliated nonprofit)

---

### 6. EMERGENCY ASSISTANCE WITH HOUSING SUPPORT

#### **The American Legion**
- **Website:** https://www.legion.org/
- **Temporary Financial Assistance (TFA):** Grants for housing, food, utilities, emergency needs
- **National Emergency Fund (NEF):** $10M+ provided for disaster relief including temporary housing
- **Homeless Veterans Support:** Connection to National Call Center (988 then press 1)
- **Geographic Scope:** National with state departments
- **Tier:** 2 (Major VSO)

---

### 7. SPECIALIZED HOUSING MODELS

#### **Tunnel to Towers Foundation - Veterans Villages**
- **Website:** https://t2t.org/homeless-veteran-program/
- **Type of Housing:** Permanent affordable housing communities
- **Locations:**
  - March Veterans Village (March Air Force Base, Riverside, CA)
  - Austin, Texas
  - Atlanta, Georgia
  - Houston, Texas
  - Birmingham, Alabama (110 units planned)

- **Model:** Permanent supportive housing with community focus
- **Tier:** 2 (Established nonprofit)

---

### 8. STATE AND REGIONAL VARIATIONS

From the codebase research, I found the DMV region already has documented:
- **US VETS - Washington DC** (1016 11th St NW, DC 20001)
  - Phone: 202-842-9433
  - 24/7 emergency intake, walk-ins accepted

- **Operation Renewed Hope Foundation** (Prince George's County, MD)
  - GPD transitional housing
  - Up to 24 months supportive housing

- **Multiple SSVF providers** documented in seed scripts

---

## SUMMARY TABLE: Non-Federal Veteran Housing Programs

| Organization | Type | Geographic Scope | Housing Type | Phone |
|---|---|---|---|---|
| **Volunteers of America** | Nonprofit | 30+ states | Transitional, PSH | 1-800-899-0089 |
| **US VETS** | Nonprofit | National | Emergency, Transitional, PSH | 1-877-548-7838 |
| **Veterans Community Project** | Nonprofit | Denver, KC, Nashville, StL | Tiny homes | https://vcp.org |
| **Swords to Plowshares** | Nonprofit | San Francisco Bay Area | PSH, Transitional | https://www.swords-to-plowshares.org/ |
| **Salvation Army** | Faith-based | National | Emergency, Transitional | 1-800-728-7825 |
| **Catholic Charities** | Faith-based | 35+ dioceses | SSVF, Transitional, PSH | https://www.catholiccharitiesusa.org/ |
| **Veterans Village of San Diego** | Nonprofit | San Diego County | PSH, Transitional | https://vvsd.net/ |
| **Nation's Finest** | Nonprofit | CA, AZ, NV | PSH, Transitional | https://nationsfinest.org/ |
| **Final Salute Inc.** | Nonprofit | DC Metro | Transitional (Women Vets) | 866-472-5883 |
| **Fisher House** | Federal nonprofit | 100+ nationwide | Family housing during treatment | https://www.fisherhouse.org/ |
| **American Legion** | VSO | National | Emergency assistance, TFA | https://www.legion.org/ |
| **Tunnel to Towers** | Nonprofit | Multiple cities | Permanent villages | https://t2t.org/ |

---

## KEY RESEARCH FINDINGS

**Already in Codebase:**
- Faith-based organizations data is comprehensively documented in `/backend/data/reference/faith_based_veteran_services.json`
- DMV regional housing resources documented in `/backend/scripts/seed_dmv_housing.py`
- Emergency assistance programs documented in `/backend/data/reference/veteran_emergency_assistance.json`

**Gap Areas to Address:**
1. **Tiny home communities** - Veterans Community Project and Tunnel to Towers represent innovative models not yet in federal program data
2. **Regional housing nonprofits** - Veterans Village networks in multiple cities
3. **Women veteran housing** - Final Salute fills specific population need
4. **Alternative housing models** - Innovative approaches beyond traditional transitional/permanent housing

**Data Sources for Integration:**
- All organizations have publicly available websites with contact info
- Most accept referrals and can provide detailed program information
- Some locations (especially Salvation Army, Volunteers of America) have presence in multiple states with local variation
- Fisher House has dedicated database of 100+ locations

---

Sources:
- [Volunteers of America](https://www.voa.org/veterans)
- [U.S. VETS Housing](https://usvets.org/how-we-serve/housing/)
- [Swords to Plowshares](https://www.swords-to-plowshares.org/)
- [Veterans Community Project](https://vcp.org/about-vcp/our-locations/kansas-city/)
- [Fisher House Foundation](https://www.fisherhouse.org/)
- [Nation's Finest Veteran Services](https://nationsfinest.org/our-services/)
- [Salvation Army Veterans Programs](https://www.salvationarmyusa.org/usn/veterans/)
- [Catholic Charities Veterans Services](https://www.catholiccharitiesusa.org/our-ministry/veterans-services/)
- [Veterans Village of San Diego](https://vvsd.net/)
- [Final Salute Inc.](https://www.finalsaluteinc.org/)
- [American Legion](https://www.legion.org/)
- [Tunnel to Towers Foundation](https://t2t.org/)
